name: Jump3D
shortDescription: Jump and fall along Z axis.
description: It handles basic collisions with 3D boxes but rotations around X and Y axes are not supported.
This extension is deprecated. The [3D physics engine](https://wiki.gdevelop.io/gdevelop5/behaviors/physics3d) should be used instead.

eventsFunctions.description: the top of the object on Z axis
eventsFunctions.name: TopZ
eventsFunctions.sentence: the top on Z axis of _PARAM1_

eventsFunctions.description: the bottom of the object on Z axis
eventsFunctions.name: BottomZ
eventsFunctions.sentence: the bottom on Z axis of _PARAM1_

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an object is overlapping a range on Z axis.
eventsFunctions.name: IsWithinZ

inlineCode: object.pick = object.getZ() < top && object.getZ() + object.getDepth() > bottom;

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Jump and fall along Z axis.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Jump3D

eventsFunctions.description: the jump height of the object. Its value is always positive.
eventsFunctions.name: JumpHeight

eventsFunctions.description: Return the jump speed to reach a given height.
eventsFunctions.name: JumpSpeedToReach

inlineCode: // Formulas used in this extension were generated from a math model.
// They are probably not understandable on their own.
// If you need to modify them or need to write new feature,
// please take a look to the platformer extension documentation:
// The implementation jumps from one quadratic resolution to another
// to find the right formula to use as the time is unknown.
+ Math.sqrt(gravity * gravity * jumpSustainTime * jumpSustainTime - 2 * jumpHeight * gravity - maxFallingSpeed * maxFallingSpeed);
jumpSpeed = -gravity * jumpSustainTime + Math.sqrt(2 * gravity * gravity * jumpSustainTime * jumpSustainTime - 4 * jumpHeight * gravity);
// affine case can't have a maximum

events.comment: Make the object fall every frame to check the floor.

eventsFunctions.description: Simulate a press of the jump key.
eventsFunctions.name: SimulateJumpKey

eventsFunctions.description: Separate from walls and land on platforms. 3D boxes rotated around X and Y axes are not supported.
eventsFunctions.name: SeparateFromPlatforms

eventsFunctions.description: Stop the object from falling and land on the floor. The object will start falling again the next frame.
eventsFunctions.name: Land

eventsFunctions.description: Make the object fall from the floor.
eventsFunctions.name: Fall

events.comment: Add a 1-frame delay in case collision checks are done after the simulate jump action.

eventsFunctions.description: Abort the current jump and stop the object vertically. This action doesn't have any effect when the character is not jumping.
eventsFunctions.name: AbortJump

eventsFunctions.description: When this action is executed, the object is able to jump again, even if it is in the air: this can be useful to allow a double jump for example. This is not a permanent effect: you must call again this action everytime you want to allow the object to jump (apart if it's on the floor).
eventsFunctions.name: SetCanJump

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object can jump.
eventsFunctions.name: CanJump

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is falling.\nNote that the object can be flagged as jumping and falling at the same time: at the end of a jump, the fall speed becomes higher than the jump speed.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFalling

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is jumping.
eventsFunctions.name: IsJumping

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is on a platform.
eventsFunctions.name: IsOnFloor

events.comment: Return the state from the previous frame because the actual state may change during the current frame according to collision.

eventsFunctions.description: the current jump speed of the object. Its value is always positive.
eventsFunctions.name: CurrentJumpSpeed

events.comment: Return the speed from the previous frame because the actual speed may change during the current frame according to collision.

eventsFunctions.description: the current falling speed of the object. Its value is always positive.
eventsFunctions.name: CurrentFallSpeed

events.comment: Return the speed from the previous frame because the actual speed may change during the current frame according to collision.

eventsFunctions.description: the current speed of the object on Z axis. Its value is negative when the object falls.
eventsFunctions.name: CurrentVerticalSpeed

events.comment: Return the speed from the previous frame because the actual speed may change during the current frame according to collision.

eventsFunctions.description: the current speed of the object on Z axis. Its value is negative when the object falls.
eventsFunctions.name: VerticalSpeed

eventsFunctions.description: the maximum falling speed of the object. Its value is always positive.
eventsFunctions.name: MaxFallingSpeed

eventsFunctions.description: the gravity of the object. Its value is always positive.
eventsFunctions.name: Gravity

eventsFunctions.description: the jump sustain time of the object. Maximum time (in seconds) during which the jump strength is sustained if the jump key is held - allowing variable height jumps.
eventsFunctions.name: JumpSustainDurationMax

eventsFunctions.description: Check if stop falling when Z equals 0.
eventsFunctions.name: ShouldStopAtZero

eventsFunctions.description: Change if stop falling when Z equals 0.
eventsFunctions.name: SetShouldStopAtZero

propertyDescriptors.label: Jump sustain time
propertyDescriptors.description: Maximum time (in seconds) during which the jump strength is sustained if the jump key is held - allowing variable height jumps.
propertyDescriptors.name: JumpSustainDurationMax
